author: Mario Parker
description: The US will pause issuance of worker visas for commercial truck drivers, the latest in a series of Trump administration moves to clampdown on foreign workers, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Thursday.
title: US to Pause Issuing Worker Visas for Truck Drivers, Rubio Says

author: Josh Wingrove
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence expressed concerns about the US government taking an equity stake in Intel Corp. and a cut of Nvidia Corp.’s AI chip sales to China.
title: Mike Pence Urges Trump to Rethink Nvidia Deal, Equity Stake in Intel

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK is bolstering its air defense capabilities with a new contract for missile systems, as European military planners work to map out a post-peace plan for Ukraine that could see its skies protected by western allies.
title: UK Expands Air Defenses as Europe Wakes Up to Missile Gap

author: Lydia Beyoud, Nicola M White, Liam Vaughan
description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is poised to take on vast new responsibilities. Staff describe chaos, cutbacks and an atmosphere of resentment and paranoia.
title: Staff Cuts and Turmoil Hit the CFTC While the Crypto It Oversees Booms

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: A Thai court is set to rule whether former premier Thaksin Shinawatra is guilty of breaking the royal defamation law, the first verdict in a string of legal cases that threatens his family’s decades-long political dominance.
title: Thai Royal Insult Verdict Against Thaksin Tests Shinawatra Clan’s Grip on Power

author: Greg Stohr
description: A divided US Supreme Court let the Trump administration at least temporarily cut off millions of dollars in medical research grants that government officials say don’t align with the president’s policies.
title: Supreme Court Lets US Cut Millions of Dollars in NIH Grants

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile President Gabriel Boric named Nicolas Grau as the nation’s new finance minister on Thursday, tapping a longtime leftist ally to fill the void after his cabinet’s most market-friendly member quit.
title: Chile President Gabriel Boric Taps Longtime Ally Nicolas Grau as Finance Minister

author: Jordan Fabian
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House editor Jordan Fabian lays looks at why the European Union’s wine and spirits industry is feeling anxious. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: US-EU Trade Deal Leaves Wine and Spirits Industries With a Hangover

author: Katy O'Donnell
description: Federal Housing Finance Agency Director Bill Pulte suggested Thursday that his referral of Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook for alleged mortgage fraud was part of a broader crackdown on the issue.
title: Pulte Says Cook Allegation Part of Wide Mortgage-Fraud Crackdown

author: Eric Martin
description: The State Department has revoked more than twice as many visas since President Donald Trump’s inauguration as the same period in 2024, an official said, as the White House looks to tout its crackdown on foreigners that it says pose a threat to public safety.
title: State Department Touts Spike in Visa Revocations Under Trump

author: David Voreacos, Justin Wise
description: Alina Habba, President Donald Trump’s pick to be the top federal prosecutor in New Jersey, was blocked from handling cases by a district court judge who said her appointment was invalid.
title: Alina Habba Blocked From Handling Cases in Rebuke to Trump

author: Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Thursday creating a new post for the government’s chief design officer and is tapping Airbnb Inc. co-founder Joe Gebbia to fill the position, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump to Tap Airbnb Co-Founder as First Government Design Chief

author: Brian Platt
description: US President Donald Trump and Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney had a “wide-ranging conversation” Thursday that included trade and the war in Ukraine, according to Carney’s office.
title: Trump and Carney Talk About Trade, Agree to Speak Again Soon

author: Laura Nahmias, Myles Miller, Patricia Hurtado
description: For Winnie Greco, a longtime adviser to New York City Mayor Eric Adams, it was a gesture of friendship. A bag of Herr’s Sour Cream & Onion ripple cut potato chips containing a red envelope with a $100 bill and a bunch of $20s enclosed as a gift to a friend.
title: Adams Adviser Hands Reporter Bag of Cash in Latest Twist to NYC Mayoral Race

author: Manuela Tobias
description: President Javier Milei suffered rapid-fire political, economic and financial setbacks this week that he’ll need to spin to his advantage as his most daunting electoral test yet draws near.
title: Milei Blasts Rivals as Setbacks Pile Up Before Buenos Aires Vote

author: Alicia Diaz
description: Two House Democrats said they would examine whether Paramount Global and Skydance Media accepted “illegitimate demands” from President Donald Trump to secure approval of their July merger.
title: Democrats Probe Paramount-Skydance Merger Over Trump Dealings

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Poland’s government revealed plans to raise a range of taxes on banks and alcohol in an effort to shore up revenue in next year’s budget and back spending on defense and social benefits.
title: Poland Plans to Hike Taxes on Banks, Alcohol in Bid to Control Ballooning Deficit

author: Ben Bartenstein
description: The US Treasury Department sanctioned a Greek shipper it said facilitated the transport of Iranian oil, broadening the Trump administration’s maximum-pressure campaign against Tehran and a crackdown on its so-called shadow fleet.
title: US Hits Greek Shipper in Expansion of Iran Max-Pressure Campaign

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he would join federal law enforcement officers patrolling the streets of Washington, DC on Thursday, a move to highlight his administration’s takeover of the city’s public safety efforts.
title: Trump Says He’ll Patrol DC Streets With Federal Officers

author: Erin Ailworth, Gerson Freitas Jr, Erik Wasson
description: For American farmers traveling through the Heartland scouting corn and soybean fields, it feels like 2019 all over again.
title: US Farmers Facing Double Whammy of Trade War and Bumper Crops

author: Tala Ahmadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: On Trumponomics, journalist and author Ben Chu explains why economies—and particularly the US—shouldn’t take globalization for granted.
title: Is Economic Self-Sufficiency a Myth?

author: Patrick Gillespie, Matthew Malinowski
description: A soccer match in Buenos Aires province erupted into chaos, with supporters of a local Argentine club recorded beating and stripping naked Chilean fans who traveled to see their team play.
title: Soccer Match Ends in Violence as Argentines Clash With Chileans

author: Sam Dagher, Abeer Abu Omar
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dispatched his top foreign-policy aide to the United Arab Emirates in a bid to improve relations strained by his government’s military campaign in Gaza and expansion of Jewish settlements in the West Bank, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Israel’s Netanyahu Sent Aide to UAE in Quiet Push to Repair Ties

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Max Ramsay
description: European officials said they’ll keep pressing for lower tariffs on wine and spirits, after a trade agreement with the US prompted an outcry from the industry by leaving exports to America subject to 15% levies.
title: EU Urges Wine, Spirits Tariff Cut as 15% US Duty Irks Industry

author: Josh Wingrove
description: The Justice Department signaled possible plans to investigate Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, with a top official informing Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell of the probe and encouraging him to remove her from the board in a letter sent Thursday.
title: DOJ Urges Fed’s Powell to Remove Cook as Probe Gets Underway

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile Finance Minister Mario Marcel resigned from his position on Thursday citing personal reasons depriving the government of its most market-friendly official.
title: Chile’s Market-Friendly Finance Chief Resigns in Shock Move

author: Erik Larson
description: A New York appeals court struck down a $464 million fraud penalty against President Donald Trump and his company in a civil suit over his asset valuations, but upheld his liability in the case, handing him a financial victory over the state’s attorney general.
title: Trump $464 Million NY Civil Fraud Penalty Vacated on Appeal

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump insinuated in a social media post that he’s open to Ukraine launching more attacks on Russia, as the White House looks to pressure Russian President Vladimir Putin to agree to a one-on-one meeting with Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
title: Trump Suggests Ukraine ‘Play Offense’ as He Pressures Putin

author: Patricia Hurtado, Laura Nahmias
description: A former top adviser to Eric Adams faces new charges over allegations she accepted $75,000 in bribes, reigniting a corruption scandal with only a few months left in the embattled New York mayor’s longshot reelection campaign.
title: Former Eric Adams Aide Faces Fresh New York Bribery Charges

author: Ntando Thukwana
description: South Africa’s central bank urgently needs to adopt a more flexible monetary-policy framework that incorporates climate-risk considerations, new research shows.
title: South Africa Urged to Factor Climate Risk Into Monetary Policy

author: Natalia Drozdiak
description: Efforts to establish security guarantees for Ukraine as part of a US-led push to end Russia’s war are running into difficulties almost immediately.
title: Doubts Grow on Ukraine Security Package as Russia Demands a Role

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: Tech companies including OpenAI, Meta Platforms Inc. and Alphabet Inc.’s Google are revving up to block US states from regulating their fast-moving and lucrative artificial intelligence businesses.
title: Tech Giants Prepare to Challenge State AI Regulations

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: International Atomic Energy Agency officials will travel to Washington next week to confer with the US as concerns grow about their inability to account for Iran’s stockpile of near-bomb grade uranium, according to diplomats with knowledge of the situation.
title: Iran’s Freeze on Nuclear Inspections Prompts UN-US Crisis Talks

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Poland’s new President Karol Nawrocki used his veto power for the first time since taking office this month to block the cabinet’s bill curbing energy prices and easing rules for investing in renewables.
title: Poland’s President Uses Veto to Block Key Green Energy Bill

author: Iain Rogers, Karin Matussek
description: Italian police detained a Ukrainian national suspected by Germany of being one of the leading protagonists in the sabotage of the Nord Stream gas pipelines in 2022.
title: Ukrainian Suspect in Nord Stream Sabotage Arrested in Italy

author: Selcan Hacaoglu, Salma El Wardany
description: Libya’s eastern parliament is poised to let Turkey explore for energy in the North African nation’s waters, according to people familiar with the matter, in what would be a dramatic about-face that’s the latest sign of warming ties between Ankara and the region.
title: Turkey Set for Gas-Exploration Deal After Wooing Ex-Libya Foes

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Russia attacked a civilian factory in western Ukraine owned by US company Flex Ltd, causing a massive fire and wounding at least 15 people.
title: Russian Missiles Strike US Electronics Plant in Western Ukraine

author: Dan Williams
description: Israel gave final approval to a controversial project to expand settlements in the West Bank, billed as dashing hopes of Palestinian statehood.
title: Israel Signs Off on Disputed West Bank Settlement Expansion

author: Levin Stamm
description: Governments are resorting to novel ways to win favor with the US president.
title: Countries Are Strategizing How to Please Trump

author: Jonnelle Marte, Maria Eloisa Capurro
description: President Donald Trump’s campaign to oust Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, if successful, would give him the opportunity to exert more influence over the US central bank by securing a majority on its seven-member board of governors.
title: Trump Aims to Win Majority on Fed Board With Attempt to Oust Lisa Cook

author: Kamran Haider, Tooba Khan
description: China and Pakistan agreed “friendship is significant” for maintaining regional peace and stability and it is indispensable for the progress of the two Asian countries.
title: China and Pakistan Hold Strategic Talks, Calling Friendship ‘Significant’

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra testified in court on a petition seeking her removal for alleged ethical misconduct, days before a ruling that could deepen the nation’s political crisis.
title: Suspended Thai PM Testifies in Court Ahead of Ouster Ruling

author: John Liu, Yujing Liu
description: President Xi Jinping warned that the Chinese government’s delayed payments to companies risk undermining people’s trust in the authorities, in a sign that Beijing is taking more seriously the problem faced by private businesses under strained public finances.
title: Xi Warns Unpaid Bills to Companies Could Damage Trust in Beijing

author: Olesia Safronova, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskiy pushed back against Russia’s idea to add China as a security guarantor in the event of a ceasefire.
title: Zelenskiy Rules Out China as One of Postwar Security Guarantors

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Swiss lawmakers have watered down a proposal that would have installed a fixed upper limit on compensation at the country’s biggest banks including UBS Group AG.
title: Swiss Banker Bonus Cap Proposal Watered Down in Parliament

author: Norman Harsono
description: A member of Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto’s cabinet has been caught in a sting operation by the nation’s anti-graft agency, according to an official.
title: Indonesia Says Cabinet Member Caught in Sting By Anti-Graft Body

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland, which has long touted its diplomatic skills as a national selling point, is going to have to rethink some long-held principles if it wants to put its recent disastrous trade negotiations with Donald Trump in the past.
title: Switzerland’s Rules-Based Diplomacy Clashes With Trump Dealmaking

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India and Russia are looking to increase their annual trade by about 50% over the next five years to reach $100 billion, seeking to reduce tariffs as both countries see mounting tensions with the US, a top envoy said.
title: India and Russia Seek to Increase Trade to $100 Billion as US Ties Fray

author: Chandra Asmara, Eko Listiyorini
description: Indonesia’s cabinet has rallied behind President Prabowo Subianto’s plan to enlist the military in his social welfare agenda, another sign of the defense sector’s growing role in Southeast Asia’s largest economy.
title: Ministers Back Prabowo’s Plan to Use Military in Social Programs

author: Rakesh Sharma, Sanjai P R
description: Back in January, India’s richest man and his wife were in Washington, attending a pre-inauguration dinner thrown for Donald Trump. In a photograph of the event shared by Reliance Industries Ltd., all three beam for the camera.
title: Billionaire Ambani Becomes Collateral Damage in Trump Trade Fury

author: Shruti Srivastava, Ruchi Bhatia
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s surprise move to lower consumption taxes within three months is set to spark tough negotiations with states, who will have to shoulder the bulk of the revenue losses.
title: Modi Faces Tough Talks With States to Approve Tax Cut Plan

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan has proposed stepping up defense spending next year, a move intended to mollify President Donald Trump, who has called on the democracy to do more to defend itself from China’s threats.
title: Taiwan Aims to Placate Trump With 2026 Military Spending Boost

author: Kate Sullivan
description: Vice President JD Vance said negotiations over ending Russia’s war in Ukraine are focused on security guarantees for Ukraine and territory Russia wants to control — including Ukrainian territory that Russia isn’t occupying — as the US tries to broker a peace deal between the two nations.
title: JD Vance Says Russia Wants Territory That’s Under Ukraine’s Control

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea has quietly built and operated a sprawling long-range missile base near the Chinese border that stores Kim Jong Un’s most advanced strategic weapons, demonstrating the regime’s ongoing efforts to advance its nuclear strike capabilities, a think tank said.
title: North Korea Reportedly Has Secret Missile Base Near China

author: Echo Wong
description: One of Taiwan’s largest pension funds has guided outside firms against using Hong Kong-registered entities to manage its money, according to people familiar with the matter, underscoring the geopolitical challenges facing the financial hub as it deepens ties with mainland China.
title: Taiwan $235 Billion Pension Avoids Hong Kong Firms for Mandates

author: Tracy Withers
description: New Zealand will buy new navy helicopters and airforce jets in the first steps toward upgrading its military capabilities to deal with rising tensions in the Asia-Pacific region.
title: New Zealand to Buy Navy Helicopters, Jets in Defense Expansion
